intro: Rhaptopetalum roseum, commonly known as the roseum rhaptopetalum, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
